intro: Macrocarpium sessile, commonly known as the sessile macrocarpium, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its foliage and flowering display.
